question: Will the DC cherry trees reach peak bloom on March 29 in 2025?
reasoning:
Based on the information gathered:

1. The National Park Service (NPS) has forecasted the peak bloom for 2025 to occur between March 28 and 31.
2. The peak bloom date is defined as when 70% of the Yoshino Cherry blossoms are open.
3. The most likely time for peak bloom is between the last week of March and the first week of April.
4. Historical data shows variability in peak bloom dates, with extremes as early as March 15 and as late as April 18.

Given that the forecasted window for peak bloom includes March 29, there is a reasonable probability that the peak bloom could occur on that date. However, the forecast is a range, and the actual date could be any day within that period.

Considering these factors, I estimate the probability that the DC cherry trees will reach peak bloom on March 29 in 2025 as follows:

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.25

search_results.title: https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/bloom-watch.htm
search_results.content:
---
title: Bloom Watch - Cherry Blossom Festival (U.S. National Park Service)
url: https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/bloom-watch.htm
hostname: nps.gov
sitename: Cherry Blossom Festival (U.S. National Park Service)
date: 2025-03-20
---


Peak Bloom March 28-31

**Follow Our Updates on Social Media**

**Facebook**: [www.facebook.com/NationalMallNPS](https://www.facebook.com/NationalMallNPS/)

**Twitter**: [twitter.com/NationalMallNPS](https://twitter.com/NationalMallNPS)

**Instagram**: [instagram.com/NationalMallNPS](https://www.instagram.com/nationalmallnps/)

#BloomWatch

#CherryBlossomDC

Peak Bloom & Blooming Period

**When is peak bloom?**

The **peak bloom date** is defined as the day when **70%** of the Yoshino Cherry (*Prunus x yedoensis*) blossoms are open. Peak bloom varies annually depending on weather conditions. The most likely time to reach peak bloom is between the last week of March and the first week of April. Extraordinary warm or cool temperatures have resulted in peak bloom as early as March 15 (1990) and as late as April 18 (1958).


**How long is peak bloom? **

The Yoshino trees typically bloom for a period of **several days**. The length of the blooming period depends on weather conditions. Cool, calm weather can extend the length of the bloom, and a rainy, windy day can bring an abrupt end to the ephemeral blossoms. A late frost can prevent the trees from blooming at all.


**Predicting the bloom.**

Forecasting peak bloom is almost impossible more than **10 days in advance**. The cherry trees' blossom development is dependent on weather conditions. National Park Service horticulturists monitor bud development and report the status of the blossoms.

Peak Bloom |

messages.content:
Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will the DC cherry trees reach peak bloom on March 29 in 2025?
Background: [In 1912](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Cherry_Blossom_Festival#Early_initiatives), the mayor of Tokyo sent 3,020 cherry trees as a symbol of friendship between Japan and the United States. The trees were largely planted around the Tidal Basin near the Jefferson Memorial. Over time, some of the original trees have died, but have been replaced or propagated, to reach a total of about [3,800 trees](https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/types-of-trees.htm) as of 2025.

Every year since 1927, the National Cherry Blossom Festival commemorates this gift with a celebration that has grown from a simple ceremony into a major cultural event drawing visitors from around the world to watch the cherries bloom, signalling the arrival of spring.

The timing of the bloom varies each year, depending on weather conditions, and is carefully tracked by the National Park Service (NPS). Peak bloom is [defined](https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/bloom-watch.htm) as the day when 70% of the [Yoshino cherry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prunus_%C3%97_yedoensis) blossoms are open - the Yoshino variety being the most common in the Tidal Basin. It usually happens in the last week of March or the first week of April, but extreme temperatures have resulted in peaks as early as March 15 (1990) and as late as April 18 (1958).

As of the beginning of March, peak bloom is forecasted to take place between March 28 and 31. Data for past blooms can be found [here](https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/bloom-watch.htm).
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as YES if the National Park Service (NPS) announces that the 2025 Peak Bloom date occurred on March 29. Otherwise, it will resolve as NO.
Fine print: If credible sources point to the peak bloom having taken place, but NPS does not officially announce a date, this question will resolve as AMBIGUOUS.
present_date: 2025-03-25T05:53:33.004214


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

Over time, some of the original trees have died, but have been replaced or propagated, to reach a total of about 3,800 trees as of 2025. Every year since 1927, the National Cherry Blossom Festival commemorates this gift with a celebration that has grown from a simple ceremony into a major cultural event drawing visitors from around the world to watch the cherries bloom, signalling the arrival of spring. The timing of the bloom varies each year, depending on weather conditions, and is carefully tracked by the National Park Service (NPS). Peak bloom is defined as the day when 70% of the Yoshino cherry blossoms are open - the Yoshino variety being the most common in the Tidal Basin. It usually happens in the last week of March or the first week of April, but extreme temperatures have resulted in peaks as early as March 15 (1990) and as late as April 18 (1958). messages.content:
{"url": "https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/bloom-watch.htm", "snippet": "---
title: Bloom Watch - Cherry Blossom Festival (U.S. National Park Service)
url: https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/bloom-watch.htm
hostname: nps.gov
sitename: Cherry Blossom Festival (U.S. National Park Service)
date: 2025-03-20
---


Peak Bloom March 28-31

**Follow Our Updates on Social Media**

**Facebook**: [www.facebook.com/NationalMallNPS](https://www.facebook.com/NationalMallNPS/)

**Twitter**: [twitter.com/NationalMallNPS](https://twitter.com/NationalMallNPS)

**Instagram**: [instagram.com/NationalMallNPS](https://www.instagram.com/nationalmallnps/)

#BloomWatch

#CherryBlossomDC

Peak Bloom & Blooming Period

**When is peak bloom?**

The **peak bloom date** is defined as the day when **70%** of the Yoshino Cherry (*Prunus x yedoensis*) blossoms are open. Peak bloom varies annually depending on weather conditions. The most likely time to reach peak bloom is between the last week of March and the first week of April. Extraordinary warm or cool temperatures have resulted in peak bloom as early as March 15 (1990) and as late as April 18 (1958).


**How long is peak bloom? **

The Yoshino trees typically bloom for a period of **several days**. The length of the blooming period depends on weather conditions. Cool, calm weather can extend the length of the bloom, and a rainy, windy day can bring an abrupt end to the ephemeral blossoms. A late frost can prevent the trees from blooming at all.


**Predicting the bloom.**

Forecasting peak bloom is almost impossible more than **10 days in advance**. The cherry trees' blossom development is dependent on weather conditions. National Park Service horticulturists monitor bud development and report the status of the blossoms.

Year |
Green Buds |
Florets Visible |
Extension of Florets |
Peduncle Elongation |
Puffy White |
Peak Bloom |
| 2025 | Mar 11 |
Mar 16 |
Mar 19 |
Mar 20 |
||
| 2024 | Mar 2 | Mar 5 | Mar 8 | Mar 12 | Mar 15 | Mar 17 |
| 2023 | Feb 23 | Mar 1 | Mar 7 | Mar 11 | Mar 18 | Mar 23 |
| 2022 | Mar 3 | Mar 7 | Mar 14 | Mar 17 | Mar 19 | Mar 21 |
| 2021 | Mar 11 | Mar 16 | Mar 22 | Mar 24 | Mar 26 | Mar 28 |
| 2020 | Feb 28 | Mar 3 | Mar 9 | Mar 12 | Mar 16 | Mar 20 |
| 2019 | Mar 5 | Mar 17 | Mar 23 | Mar 25 | Mar 29 | Apr 1 |
| 2018 | Feb 25 | Mar 15 | Mar 26 | Mar 29 | Apr 1 | Apr 5 |
| 2017 | Feb 24 | Mar 1 | Mar 6 | Mar 8 | Mar 22* | Mar 25* |
| 2016 | Mar 8 | Mar 13 | Mar 15 | Mar 17 | Mar 22 | Mar 25 |
| 2015 | Mar 18 | Apr 1 | Apr 4 | Apr 6 | Apr 8 | Apr 10 |
| 2014 | Mar 16 | Ma…

[Truncated preview: showing 482 words out of ~848. Full content available via `btf_extract_evidence`.]", "word_count": 848, "snippet_word_count": 482, "snippet_truncated": true, "date_cutoff_start": "2025-02-25T05:53:33.004214", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-03-26T05:53:33.004214", "cached_at": "2025-10-23T21:14:35.377455"}

messages.name: btf_extract_evidence

messages.content:
Based on the information gathered:

1. The National Park Service (NPS) has forecasted the peak bloom for 2025 to occur between March 28 and 31.
2. The peak bloom date is defined as when 70% of the Yoshino Cherry blossoms are open.
3. The most likely time for peak bloom is between the last week of March and the first week of April.
4. Historical data shows variability in peak bloom dates, with extremes as early as March 15 and as late as April 18.

Given that the forecasted window for peak bloom includes March 29, there is a reasonable probability that the peak bloom could occur on that date. However, the forecast is a range, and the actual date could be any day within that period.

Considering these factors, I estimate the probability that the DC cherry trees will reach peak bloom on March 29 in 2025 as follows:

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.25
